photos.name: Mountains
photos.description: a large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level; a large steep hill.

photos.name: Lighthouse
photos.description: a tower or other structure containing a beacon light to warn or guide ships at sea.

photos.name: Castle
photos.description: a large building or group of buildings fortified against attack with thick walls, battlements, towers, and in many cases a moat.

photos.name: Church
photos.description: a building used for public Christian worship.

photos.name: Old Barn
photos.description: a large farm building used for storing grain, hay, or straw or for housing livestock.

photos.name: Maple Leaf
photos.description: the leaf of the maple, used as an emblem of Canada.

photos.name: Horse
photos.description: a solid-hoofed plant-eating domesticated mammal with a flowing mane and tail, used for riding, racing, and to carry and pull loads.

photos.name: Bear
photos.description: Bears are classified as caniforms, or doglike carnivorans, with the pinnipeds being their closest living relatives.
